card.base79.text: Descarta Descarta una carta de Energía unida a 1 de tus Pokémon para poder elegir 1 de los Pokémon de tu rival y hasta 2 cartas de Energía que estén unidas a éste.
card.base80.name: Defensor
card.base80.text: Une Defensor a 1 de tus Pokémon. El siguiente turno, descarta a Defensor. Se reducen 20 puntos de daño por ataques a ese Pokémon (después de aplicar Debilidad y Resistencia).
card.base81.name: Recuperación de Energía
card.base81.text: Intercambia 1 de las cartas en tu mano por hasta 2 cartas básicas de Energías de tu pozo de descarte.
card.base82.name: Cura Total
card.base82.text: Tu Pokémon Activo deja de estar Dormido, Confundido, Paralizado o Envenenado.
card.base83.name: Mantenimiento
card.base83.text: Baraja 2 de las cartas de tu mano en tu mazo para poder robar una carta.
card.base84.name: PoderPlus
card.base84.text: Une a PoderPlus a tu Pokémon Activo. Si el ataque de este Pokémon hace daño al Pokémon a la defensa (después de que apliques Debilidad y Resistencia), el ataque hace 10 puntos más de daño al Pokémon a la defensa.
card.base85.name: Centro Pokémon
card.base85.text: Quita todos los contadores de daño de todos tus Pokémon que tengan contadores de daño, luego descarta todas las cartas de Energía unidas a esos Pokémon.
card.base86.name: Poké Flauta
card.base86.text: Elige una carta de Pokémon Básico del pozo de descarte de tu rival y ponla en su Banca.
card.base87.name: Pokédex
card.base87.text: Mira hasta 5 cartas de la parte superior de tu mazo y vuelve a arreglarlas como tú desees.
card.base88.name: Profesor Oak
card.base88.text: Descarta tu mano, luego roba 7 cartas.
card.base89.name: Revivir
card.base89.text: Pon una carta de Pokémon Básico de tu pozo de descarte en tu Banca. on la cantidad de contadores de daño sobre ese Pokémon equivalente a la mitad de sus PI (redondeando al 10 más cercano).
card.base90.name: Superpoción
card.base90.text: Descarta una carta de energía unida a 1 de tus Pokémon para poder quitar hasta 4 contadores de daño de ese Pokémon.
card.base91.name: Bill
card.base92.name: Quite de Energía
card.base92.text: Elige 1 Carta de Energía unida a 1 de los Pokémon de tu rival y descártala.
card.base93.name: Golpe de viento
card.base93.text: Elige 1 de los Pokémon de la Banca de tu rival y cámbialo con su Pokémon Activo.
card.base94.name: Poción
card.base94.text: Quita hasta 2 contadores de daño de 1 de tus Pokémon.
card.base94.effect.selector: Selecciona el Pokémon con el que quieres usar la Poción.
card.base95.name: Cambio
card.base95.text: Cambia 1 de tus Pokémon de la Banca con tu Pokémon Activo.
card.base96.name: Energía Incolora Doble
card.base96.text: Provee 2 de Energía Incolora. No cuenta como una carta de Energía básica.
card.base97.name: Energía Lucha
card.base98.name: Energía Fuego
card.base99.name: Energía Planta
card.base100.name: Energía Rayo
card.base101.name: Energía Psíquica
card.base102.name: Energía Agua

card.jung1.name: Clefable

attack.jung2.1.name: Placaje
attack.jung2.2.name: Relámpago en Cadena
attack.jung2.2.text: Si el Pokémon a la defensa no es Incoloro, este ataque hace 10 puntos de daño a cada uno de los Pokémon en la Banca que sean del mismo tipo (incluyendo los tuyos).

attack.jung3.1.name: Ataque rápido
attack.jung3.1.text: Lanza 1 moneda. Si sale cara, este ataque hace 20 puntos más de daño.
attack.jung3.2.name: Lanzallamas
attack.jung3.2.text: Descarta una carta de Energía Fuego unida a Flareon para poder usar este ataque.

attack.jung4.1.name: Ataque rápido
attack.jung4.1.text: Lanza 1 moneda. Si sale cara, este ataque hace 20 puntos más de daño.
attack.jung4.2.name: Pin Misil
attack.jung4.2.text: Lanza 4 monedas. Este ataque hace 20 puntos de daño multiplicado por la cantidad de caras que hayan salido.

ability.jung6.name: Pared Invisible
ability.jung6.text: Toda vez que un ataque haga 30 o más puntos de daño a Mr. Mime previene ese daño, cualquier otro efecto de los ataques se cuenta. No puede ser usado si está Dormido, Confundido o Paralizado.
attack.jung6.1.name: Meditar
attack.jung6.1.text: Hace 10 puntos de daño mas otros 10 puntos más por cada contador de daño que haya sobre el Pokémon a la defensa.

attack.jung7.1.name: Admiradores

attack.jung7.2.name: Mega Puño

attack.jung8.2.name: Huracán

attack.jung61.1.name: Malicioso
attack.jung61.1.text: Lanza 1 moneda. Si sale cara, el Pokémon a la defensa no puede atacar a Rhyhorn durante el próximo turno de tu rival.
attack.jung61.2.name: Cornada
card.jung62.name: Spearow
attack.jung62.1.name: Picotazo
attack.jung62.2.name: Movimiento espejo
attack.jung62.2.text: Si Spearow fue atacado en el último turno, haz resultado final de ese ataque sobre Spearow al Pokémon a la defensa.
card.jung63.name: Venonat
attack.jung63.1.name: Paralizador
attack.jung63.1.text: Lanza 1 moneda. Si sale cara, el Pokémon a la defensa pasa a estar Paralizado.
attack.jung63.2.name: Chupa vidas
attack.jung63.2.text: Cura a Venonat igual a todo el daño hecho al Pokémon a la defensa.
card.jung64.name: Poké Ball
card.jung64.text: Lanza 1 moneda. Si sale cara, busca en tu baraja 1 Pokémon, enséñalo y ponlo en tu mano. Después, baraja las cartas de tu baraja.

deck.powerReserve.name: Reserva de Poder
set.foss.name: Fósil
card.foss1.name: Aerodactyl
ability.foss1.name: Poderio Prehistórico
ability.foss1.text: No se pueden jugar más cartas de Evolución. Este poder deja de funcionar cuando está Dormido, Confundido o Paralizado.
attack.foss1.1.name: Ataque-Ala
card.foss2.name: Articuno
attack.foss2.1.name: Congelar a seco
attack.foss2.1.text: Lanza 1 moneda. Si sale cara, el Pokémon a la defensa pasa a estar Paralizado.
attack.foss2.2.name: Ventisca
attack.foss2.2.text: Lanza 1 moneda. Si sale cara, este ataque hace 10 puntos de daño a cada uno de los Pokémon en la Banca de tu rival. Si sale cruz, este ataque hace 10 puntos de daño a cada uno de los Pokémon en tu Banca.
card.foss3.name: Ditto
ability.foss3.name: Transformación
ability.foss3.text: Si Ditto es tu Pokémon Activo, trátalo como si fuera la misma carta que el Pokémon a la defensa, exceptuando que Ditto no puede evolucionar, puedes tratar a la Energía que esté unida a Ditto como Energía de cualquier tipo. Deja de funcionar cuando está Dormido, Confundido o Paralizado.
card.foss4.name: Dragonite
ability.foss4.name: Vuelo de Rescate
ability.foss4.text: Una vez durante tu turno (antes de tu ataque), si Dragonite está en tu banca, puedes intercambiarlo con tu Pokémon Activo.
attack.foss4.1.name: Portazo
attack.foss4.1.text: Lanza 2 monedas. Este ataque hace 40 puntos de daño multiplicado por la cantidad de caras que hayan salido.
card.foss5.name: Gengar
ability.foss5.name: Maldición
ability.foss5.text: Una vez durante tu turno (antes de tu ataque), puedes mover un contador de daño de uno de los Pokémon de tu rival a otro (incluso icluso si deja fuera de combate al otro Pokémon). Este poder no puede ser usado cuando esté Dormido, Confundido o Paralizado.
attack.foss5.1.name: Mente Oscura
attack.foss5.1.text: Si tu rival tiene algún Pokemon en su Banca, elije 1 de ellos y este ataque le hace 10 puntos de daño. (No apliques Debilidad y Resistencia para los Pokémon en la Banca).
card.foss6.name: Haunter
ability.foss6.name: Transparencia
ability.foss6.text: Toda vez que un ataque haga algo a Haunter, lanza 1 moneda. Si sale cara, previene todos los efectos que ese ataque haga a Haunter, incluyendo daño. Este poder no puede ser usado cuando esté Dormido, Confundido o Paralizado.
attack.foss6.1.name: Pesadilla
attack.foss6.1.text: El Pokémon a la defensa pasa a estar Dormido.
card.foss7.name: Hitmonlee
attack.foss7.1.name: Patada Estrecha
attack.foss7.1.text: Si tu oponente tiene algun Pokémon en la banca, elige alguno de ellos y este ataque le hace 20 de daño. (No aplicar Resistencia y Debilidad para los Pokémon en la banca).
attack.foss7.2.name: Gran Patada Alta
card.foss8.name: Hypno
attack.foss8.1.name: Profecía
attack.foss8.1.text: Busca hasta 3 cartas de la parte superior de los mazos de cualquiera de los dos jugadores y vuelve a acomodarlas como quieras.
attack.foss8.2.name: Mente Oscura
attack.foss8.2.text: Si tu rival tiene algún Pokemon en su Banca, elije 1 de ellos y este ataque le hace 10 puntos de daño. (No apliques Debilidad y Resistencia para los Pokémon en la Banca).
card.foss9.name: Kabutops
attack.foss9.1.name: Hoz afilada
attack.foss9.2.name: Absorber
attack.foss9.2.text: Quita una cantidad de contadores de daño de Kabutops igual a la mitad del daño hecho al Pokémon a la defensa (después de aplicar Debilidad y Resistencia) (redondear el número al 10 más cercano). Si Kabuto tiene menos contadores de daño que el número resultante, quítaselos todos.
card.foss10.name: Lapras
attack.foss10.1.name: Pistola agua
attack.foss10.1.text: Hace 10 puntos de daño más 10 puntos de daño adicionales por cada Energía Agua unida a Lapras, pero que no sea usada para pagar el coste de Energía de este ataque. No puedes agregar más de 20 puntos de daño de esta manera.
attack.foss10.2.name: Rayo confuso
attack.foss10.2.text: Lanza 1 moneda. Si sale cara, el Pokémon a la defensa pasa a estar Confundido.
card.foss11.name: Magneton
attack.foss11.1.name: Explosión sónica
attack.foss11.1.text: No apliques Debilidad ni Resistencia para este ataque. (Ocurre cualquier otro efecto que ocurriría despuués de aplicar Debilidad y Resistencia).
attack.foss11.2.name: Autodestrucción
attack.foss11.2.text: Hace 20 puntos de daño a cada Pokémon en la banca de cada jugador, (No apliques Debilidad o Resistencia para los Pokémon en la Banca). Magneton se hace 100 puntos de daño a sí mismo.
card.foss12.name: Moltres
attack.foss12.1.name: Reguero de pólvora
attack.foss12.1.text: Puedes descartar cualquier cantidad de cartas de energía Fuego unidas a Moltres cuando uses este ataque. Si lo haces, descarta la misma cantidad de cartas de la parte superior del mazo de tu rival.
attack.foss12.2.name: Bombardeo en picada
attack.foss12.2.text: Lanza 1 moneda. Si sale cruz, este ataque no hace nada.

ability.foss13.name: Gas Tóxico
ability.foss13.text: Ignora todos los Poderes de Pokémon que no sea Gas Tóxico. Este poder deja de funcionar cuando Muk está Dormido, Confundido o Paralizado.

attack.foss13.1.text: Lanza 1 moneda. Si sale cara, el Pokémon a la defensa pasa a estar Envenenado.

attack.foss14.1.name: Giga-choque

attack.foss56.1.name: Ácido
card.foss57.name: Zubat
attack.foss57.1.name: Supersónico
attack.foss57.1.text: Lanza 1 moneda. Si sale cara, el Pokémon a la defensa pasa a estar Confundido.
attack.foss57.2.name: Chupavidas
attack.foss57.2.text: Quita una cantidad de contadores de daño de Zubat igual al daño hecho al Pokémon a la defensa (después de aplicar Debilidad y Resistencia). Si Zubat tiene menos contadores de daño que el número resultante, quítaselos todos.
card.foss58.name: Sr. Fuji
card.foss58.text: Elige un Pokémon de tu Banca. Barájalo en tu mazo, junto con todas las cartas que tenga unidas.
card.foss59.name: Búsqueda de Energía
card.foss59.text: Busca una carta de Energía Básica en tu mazo y colócala en tu mano. Después, baraja tu mazo.
card.foss60.name: Jugador
card.foss60.text: Mezcla tu mano en tu mazo. Lanza 1 moneda. Si sale cara, roba 8 cartas. Si sale cruz, roba 1 carta.
card.foss61.name: Reciclaje
card.foss61.text: Lanza 1 moneda. Si sale cara, pon una carta de tu pozo de descarte en la parte superior de tu mazo.
card.foss62.name: Fósil Misterioso
card.foss62.text: Juega a Fósil Misterioso como si fuera un Pokémon Básico. Mientras está en juego, Fósil Misterioso cuenta como un Pokémon (en lugar de una carta de Entrenador). Fósil Misterioso no tiene ataques, no puede retirarse, y no puede ser Dormido, Confundido, Paralizado o Envenenado. Si Fósil Misterioso queda fuera de combate, no cuenta como Pokémon fuera de combate. (Igualmente descártalo). En cualquier momento de tu turno antes de tu ataque, puedes descartar a Fósil Misterioso del juego.
set.tero.name: Team Rocket
card.tero1.name: Dark Alakazam
attack.tero1.1.name: Teleport Blast
attack.tero1.1.text: You may switch Dark Alakazam with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)
attack.tero1.2.name: Mind Shock
attack.tero1.2.text: Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)
card.tero2.name: Dark Arbok
attack.tero2.1.name: Stare
attack.tero2.1.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.) If that Pokémon has a Pokémon Power, that power stops working until the end of your opponent's next turn.
attack.tero2.2.name: Poison Vapor
attack.tero2.2.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
card.tero3.name: Dark Blastoise
attack.tero3.1.name: Hydrocannon
attack.tero3.1.text: Does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Dark Blastoise but not used to pay for this attack. You can't add more than 40 damage in this way.
attack.tero3.2.name: Rocket Tackle
attack.tero3.2.text: Dark Blastoise does 10 damage to itself. Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Dark Blastoise during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)
card.tero4.name: Dark Charizard
attack.tero4.1.name: Nail Flick
attack.tero4.2.name: Continuous Fireball
attack.tero4.2.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Fire Energy cards attached to Dark Charizard. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads. Discard a number of Fire Energy cards attached to Dark Charizard equal to the number of heads.
card.tero5.name: Dark Dragonite
ability.tero5.name: Summon Minions
ability.tero5.text: When you play Dark Dragonite from your hand, search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.
attack.tero5.1.name: Giant Tail
attack.tero5.1.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.
card.tero6.name: Dark Dugtrio
ability.tero6.name: Sinkhole
ability.tero6.text: Whenever your opponent's Active Pokémon retreats, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, this power does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.) This power stops working while Dark Dugtrio is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
attack.tero6.1.name: Knock Down
attack.tero6.1.text: Your opponent flips a coin. If tails, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage; if heads, this attack does 20 damage.
card.tero7.name: Dark Golbat

ability.tero7.text: When you play Dark Golbat from your hand, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. If you do, Dark Golbat does 10 damage to that Pokémon. Apply Weakness and Resistance.

attack.tero7.1.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)
card.tero8.name: Dark Gyarados
ability.tero8.name: Final Beam
ability.tero8.text: When Dark Gyarados is Knocked Out by an attack, flip a coin. If heads, this power does 20 damage for each Water Energy attached to Dark Gyarados to the Pokémon that Knocked Out Dark Gyarados. Apply Weakness and Resistance. This power doesn't work if Dark Gyarados is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
attack.tero8.1.name: Ice Beam
attack.tero8.1.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

card.tero15.text: Each player plays with their Prize cards face up for the rest of the game.
card.tero16.name: Rocket's Sneak Attack
card.tero16.text: Look at your opponent's hand. If he or she has any Trainer cards, choose 1 of them. Your opponent shuffles that card into his or her deck.
card.tero71.name: Here Comes Team Rocket!
card.tero71.text: Each player plays with their Prize cards face up for the rest of the game.
card.tero72.name: Rocket's Sneak Attack
card.tero72.text: Look at your opponent's hand. If he or she has any Trainer cards, choose 1 of them. Your opponent shuffles that card into his or her deck.
card.tero73.name: The Boss's Way
card.tero73.text: Search your deck for an Evolution card with Dark in its name. Show it to your opponent, then put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
card.tero74.name: Challenge!
card.tero74.text: Ask your opponent if he or she accepts your challenge. If your opponent declines (or if both Benches are full), draw 2 cards. If your opponent accepts, each of you searches your decks for any number of Basic Pokémon cards and puts them face down onto your Benches. (A player can't do this if his or her Bench is full.) When you both have finished, shuffle your decks and turn those cards face up.
card.tero75.name: Digger
card.tero75.text: Flip a coin. If tails, do 10 damage to your Active Pokémon. If heads, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, your opponent does 10 damage to his or her Active Pokémon. If heads, you flip a coin. Keep doing this until a player gets tails.
card.tero76.name: Imposter Oak's Revenge
card.tero76.text: Discard a card from your hand in order to play this card. Your opponent shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck, then draws 4 cards.
card.tero77.name: Nightly Garbage Run
card.tero77.text: Choose up to 3 Basic Pokémon cards, Evolution cards, and/or basic Energy cards from your discard pile. Show them to your opponent and shuffle them into your deck.
card.tero78.name: Goop Gas Attack
card.tero78.text: All Pokémon Powers stop working until the end of your opponent's next turn.
card.tero79.name: Sleep!
card.tero79.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.
card.tero17.name: Rainbow Energy
card.tero17.text: Not a Basic Energy. Provides every type of Basic Energy, but only 1 at a time. Deals 10 damage to the Pokémon this is attached to.
card.tero80.name: Rainbow Energy
card.tero80.text: Not a Basic Energy. Provides every type of Basic Energy, but only 1 at a time. Deals 10 damage to the Pokémon this is attached to.
card.tero81.name: Full Heal Energy
card.tero81.text: Not a Basic Energy. Provides 1 Colorless Energy. Removes Sleep, Confusion, Paralysis and Poison from the Pokémon this is attached to.
card.tero82.name: Potion Energy
card.tero82.text: Not a Basic Energy. Provides 1 Colorless Energy. Remove 1 damage counter from the Pokémon this is attached to.
set.wbsp.name: Wizards Black Star Promos
card.wbsp1.name: Pikachu
attack.wbsp1.1.name: Growl
attack.wbsp1.1.text: If the Defending Pokémon attacks Pikachu during your opponent's next turn, any damage done by the attack is reduced by 10.
attack.wbsp1.2.name: Thundershock
attack.wbsp1.2.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
card.wbsp2.name: Electabuzz
attack.wbsp2.1.name: Light Screen
attack.wbsp2.1.text: Whenever an attack does damage to Electabuzz (after applying Weakness and Resistance) during your opponent's next turn, that attack only does half the damage to Electabuzz (rounded down to the nearest 10).
attack.wbsp2.2.name: Quick Attack
attack.wbsp2.2.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.
card.wbsp3.name: Mewtwo
attack.wbsp3.1.name: Energy Absorption
attack.wbsp3.1.text: Choose up to 2 Energy cards from your discard pile and attach them to Mewtwo.
attack.wbsp3.2.name: Psyburn
card.wbsp4.name: Pikachu
attack.wbsp4.1.name: Recharge
attack.wbsp4.1.text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to Pikachu. Shuffle your deck afterwards.
attack.wbsp4.2.name: Thunderbolt
attack.wbsp4.2.text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Pikachu.
card.wbsp5.name: Dragonite
ability.wbsp5.name: Special Delivery
ability.wbsp5.text: Once during your turn, you may draw a card. Then, put a card from your hand on top of your deck. Disabled by Sleep, Confusion and Paralysis.
attack.wbsp5.1.name: Supersonic Flight
attack.wbsp5.1.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.
card.wbsp6.name: Arcanine
attack.wbsp6.1.name: Quick Attack
attack.wbsp6.1.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.
attack.wbsp6.2.name: Flames of Rage
attack.wbsp6.2.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy attached to Arcanine. This attack does 40 damage plus 10 damage per damage counter on Arcanine.
card.wbsp7.name: Jigglypuff
attack.wbsp7.1.name: First Aid
attack.wbsp7.2.name: Double-edge
card.wbsp8.name: Mew
attack.wbsp8.1.name: Psywave
attack.wbsp8.1.text: Does 10 damage times the number of Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokémon.
attack.wbsp8.2.name: Devolution Beam
attack.wbsp8.2.text: Choose an evolved Pokémon. Return the highest Stage Evolution card on that Pokémon to its owner. That Pokémon is no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned, or anything else that might be the result of an attack (just as if you had evolved it).
card.wbsp9.name: Mew
attack.wbsp9.1.name: Psywave
attack.wbsp9.1.text: Does 10 damage times the number of Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokémon.
attack.wbsp9.2.name: Devolution Beam
attack.wbsp9.2.text: Choose an evolved Pokémon. Return the highest Stage Evolution card on that Pokémon to its owner. That Pokémon is no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned, or anything else that might be the result of an attack (just as if you had evolved it).
card.wbsp10.name: Meowth
attack.wbsp10.1.name: Cat Punch
attack.wbsp10.1.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage. If tails, your opponent chooses one of their Benched Pokémon; this attack does 20 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
card.wbsp11.name: Eevee
ability.wbsp11.name: Chain Reaction
ability.wbsp11.text: This power can only be used when a Pokémon evolves. Search your deck for a card that evolves from Eevee and attach it to Eevee. This counts as evolving Eevee. Shuffle your deck afterwards. This power can't be used if Eevee is Alsleep, Confused or Paralyzed.
attack.wbsp11.1.name: Bite
card.wbsp12.name: Mewtwo
attack.wbsp12.1.name: Energy Control
attack.wbsp12.1.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and attack it to another of your opponent's Pokémon of your choice.
attack.wbsp12.2.name: Telekinesis
attack.WSBP12.2.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)
card.wbsp13.name: Venusaur
ability.wbsp13.name: Solar Power
ability.wbsp13.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. Your Active Pokémon and the Defending Pokémon are no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned. This power can't be used if Venusaur is Asleep, Confused or Paralyzed.
attack.wbsp13.1.name: Mega Drain
attack.wbsp13.1.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Venusaur equal to half the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Venusaur has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.
card.wbsp14.name: Mewtwo
attack.wbsp14.1.name: Energy Absorption
attack.wbsp14.1.text: Choose up to 2 Energy cards from your discard pile and attach them to Mewtwo.
attack.wbsp14.2.name: Psyburn
card.wbsp15.name: Cool Porygon
attack.wbsp15.1.name: Texture Magic
attack wbsp15.1.text: You may change Cool Porygon's Resistance to a type of your choice other than Colorless. If the Defending Pokémon was a weakness, you may change it to a type of your choice other than Colorless. (Benching either Pokémon ends the effect on that Pokémon.)
attack.wbsp15.2.name: 3-D Attack
attack.wbsp15.2.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.
card.wbsp16.name: Computer Error
card.wbsp16.text: You may draw up to 5 cards, then your opponent may draw up to 5 cards. Your turn is over now. (You don't get to attack.)
card.wbsp17.name: Dark Persian
attack.wbsp17.1.name: Fascinate
attack.wbsp17.1.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with the Defending Pokémon. This attack can't be used if your opponent has no benched Pokémon.
attack.wbsp17.2.name: Poison Claws
attack.wbsp17.2.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.
card.wbsp18.name: Team Rocket's Meowth
attack.wbsp18.1.name: Miraculous Comeback
attack.WSBP18.1.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Pokémon in play. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads. Then, Team Rocket's Meowth does 10 damage times the number of tails to itself.
card.wbsp19.name: Sabrina's Abra
attack.wbsp19.1.name: Pound
attack.wbsp19.2.name: Synchronize
attack.wbsp19.2.text: This attack can't be used unless Sabrina's Abra and the Defending Pokémon have the same number of Energy cards attached to them.
card.wbsp20.name: Psyduck
attack.wbsp20.1.name: Headache
attack.wbsp20.1.text: Your opponent can't play Trainer Cards during his or her next turn.
attack.wbsp20.2.name: Fury Swipes
attack.wbsp20.2.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.
card.wbsp21.name: Moltres
attack.wbsp21.1.name: Hyper Flame
attack.wbsp21.1.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard 1 Fire Energy card to Moltres. If tails, discard all Energy cards attached to Moltres. If you can't discard Energy cards, this attack does nothing.
card.wbsp.22.name: Articuno
attack.wbsp22.1.name: Diamond Dust
attack.wbsp22.1.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed, and this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's benched Pokémon.(Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
card.wbsp23.name: Zapdos
attack.wbsp23.1.name: Lightning Burn
attack.wbsp23.1.text: Flip a coin. If heads, and if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon.(Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) If tails, Zapdos does 30 damage to itself.
card.wbsp24.name: __________'s Pikachu
attack.wbsp24.1.name: Birthday Surprise
attack.wbsp24.1.text: If it's not your birthday, this attack does 30 damage. If it is your birthday, flip a coin. If heads, this does 30 damage plus 50 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage.
card.wbsp25.name: Flying Pikachu
attack.wbsp25.1.name: Thundershock
attack.wbsp25.1.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
attack.wbsp25.2.name: Fly
attack.wbsp25.2.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Flying Pikachu; if tails, this attack does nothing(not even damage).
card.wbsp26.name: Pikachu
attack.wbsp26.1.name: Scratch
attack.wbsp26.2.name: Thunderbolt
attack.wbsp26.2.text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Pikachu.
card.wbsp27.name: Pikachu
attack.wbsp27.1.name: Thundershock
attack.wbsp27.1.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
attack.wbsp27.2.name: Agility
attack.wbsp27.2.text: Flip a coin, If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Pikachu.
card.wbsp28.name: Surfing Pikachu
attack.wbsp28.1.name: Surf
card.wbsp29.name: Marill
attack.wbsp29.1.name: Water Gun
attack.wbsp29.1.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Marill but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.
card.wbsp30.name: Togepi
attack.wbsp30.1.name: Snivel
attack.wbsp30.1.text: If the Defending Pokémon attacks Togepi during your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Togepi is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance.) (Benching either Pokémon ends this effect.)
attack.wbsp30.2.name: Mini-Metronome
attack.wbsp30.2.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon attacks. Mini-Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy cost. (You must still do anything else in order to use that attack.) (No mater what type the Defending Pokémon is, Togepi's type is still Colorless.) Togepi performs that attack.
card.wbsp31.name: Cleffa
attack.wbsp31.name: Eek
card.wbsp32.name: Smeargle
attack.wbsp32.1.name: Paint
attack.wbsp32.1.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a type (other than Colorless) and put a Coloring counter on the Defending Pokémon. That Pokémon is now the type you chose. If it already has a Coloring counter, remove the old one. If tails, this attack does nothing.
card.wbsp33.name: Scizor
attack.wbsp33.1.name: Leer
attack.wbsp33.1.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack Scizor during your opponent's next turn. (Benching either Pokémon ends this effect.)
attack.wbsp33.2.name: Metal Pincher
attack.wbsp33.2.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.
card.wbsp34.name: Entei
ability.wbsp34.name: Bolt
ability.wbsp34.text: Whenever your opponent's attack damages Entei, unless that Knocks Out Entei, flip a coin. If heads, shuffle Entei and all cards attached to it into your deck. This power can't be used if Entei is already Asleep, Confused or Paralyzed when it is damaged.
attack.wbsp34.1.name: Protective Flame
attack.wbsp34.1.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to your Benched Pokémon.
card.wbsp35.name: Pichu
attack.wbsp35.1.name: Let's Play!
attack.wbsp35.1.text: Search your deck for a Baby Pokémon card and put it on your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterwards. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)
card.wbsp36.name: Igglybuff
attack.wbsp36.1.name: Good Night Song
attack.wbsp36.1.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.
card.wbsp37.name: Hitmontop
attack.wbsp37.1.name: Repeating Kick
attack.wbsp37.1.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.
attack.wbsp37.2.name: Rapid Spin
attack.wbsp37.2.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with his or her Active Pokémon, then, if you have any Benched Pokémon, you switch 1 of them with your Active Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)
card.wbsp38.name: Unown J
ability.wbsp38.name: Join
ability.wbsp38.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Unown J, Unown O, Unown I and Unown N on your bench, you may search your deck for a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card. Show that card to your opponent, then put it into your hand, Shuffle your deck afterwards.
attack.wbsp38.1.name: Hidden Power
card.wbsp39.name: Misdreavus
attack.wbsp39.1.name: Pain Split
attack.wbsp39.1.text: Put 1 damage counter on the Defending Pokémon for each damage counter on Misdreavus.
attack.wbsp39.2.name: Confuse Ray
attack.wbsp39.2.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.
card.wbsp40.name: Pokémon Center
card.wbsp40.text: Remove all damage counters from all of your Pokémon with damage counters on them, then discard all Energy cards attached to those Pokémon.
card.wbsp41.name: Lucky Stadium
card.wbsp41.text: During each player's turn (before he or she attacks), that may flip a coin. If heads, he or she draws a card. This card stays in play after being played. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
card.wbsp42.name: Pokémon Tower
card.wbsp42.text: If the effect of a Pokémon Power, attack, Energy card or Trainer card would put a card in a discard pile into its owner's hand, that card stays in that discard pile instead. This card stays in play after being played. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
card.wbsp43.name: Machamp
attack.wbsp43.1.name: Seething Anger
attack.wbsp43.1.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of damage counters on Machamp. This attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.
attack.wbsp43.2.name: Fling
attack.wbsp43.2.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)
card.wbsp44.name: Magmar
attack.wbsp44.1.name: Burning Fire
attack.wbsp44.1.text: When you use this attack, you may discard any number of Fire Energy cards attached to your Pokémon in play. This attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Fire Energy card you discard in this way.
attack.wbsp44.2.name: Magma Punch
card.wbsp45.name: Scyther
attack.wbsp45.1.name: Slashing Strike
attack.wbsp45.1.text: Scyther can't use this attack during your next turn. (Benching or Evolving Scyther ends this effect.)
card.wbsp46.name: Electabuzz
attack.wbsp46.1.name: Lightning Rod
attack.wbsp46.1.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and put a Lightning Rod marker on it. (A Pokémon can only have 1 Lightning Rod marker on it at a time.)
attack.wbsp46.2.name: Lightning Bolt
attack.wbsp46.2.text: This attack does 20 damage to any Pokémon with a Lightning Rod marker on it. Apply Weakness and Resistance.
card.wbsp47.name: Mew
ability.wbsp47.name: Neutral Shield
ability.wbsp47.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Mew by Evolved Pokémon. You can't use this power if Mew is Asleep, Confused or Paralyzed.
attack.wbsp47.1.name: Psyshock
attack.wbsp47.1.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
card.wbsp48.name: Articuno
ability.wbsp48.name: Aurora Veil
ability.wbsp48.text: As long as Articuno is your Active Pokémon, your Benched Pokémon do not take damage from and are not affected by attacks. This Power cannot be used if Articuno is affected by a Special Condition.
attack.wbsp48.1.name: Ice Beam
attack.wbsp48.1.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
card.wbsp49.name: Snorlax
ability.wbsp49.name: Guard
ability.wbsp49.text: As long as Snorlax is your Active Pokémon, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat. This Power stops working when Snorlax is affected by a Special Condition.
attack.wbsp49.name: Roll Over
attack.wbsp49.text: Snorlax is now Asleep. Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.
card.wbsp50.name: Celebi
attack.wbsp50.name: Leaf Slice
attack.wbsp50.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.
card.wbsp51.name: Rapidash
attack.wbsp51.1.name: Jump Over
attack.wbsp51.1.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them. Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
attack.wbsp51.2.name: Super Singe
attack.wbsp51.2.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.
card.wbsp52.name: Ho-Oh
attack.wbsp52.1.name: Sacred Wing
attack.wbsp52.1.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack's base damage is 20 instead of 60.
card.wbsp53.name: Suicune
ability.wbsp53.name: Pure Body
ability.wbsp53.text: To attach a Water Energy card from your hand to Suicune, you must discard an Energy card attached to Suicune. (Attach the Water Energy, and then discard an Energy card from Suicune.)
attack.wbsp53.1.name: Hypno Wave
attack.wbsp53.1.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage. If tails, this attack does 30 damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.
set.gymh.name: Gym Heroes
card.gymh1.name: Blaine's Moltres
attack.gymh1.1.name: Phoenix Flame
attack.gymh1.1.text: Flip a coin. If tails, shuffle Blaine's Moltres and all cards attached to it into your deck (after doing damage).
card.gymh10.name: Misty's Tentacruel
attack.gymh10.1.name: Jellyfish Poison
attack.gymh10.1.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.
card.gymh100.name: Erika
card.gymh100.text: You may draw up to 3 cards, then your opponent may draw up to 3 cards.
card.gymh101.name: Lt. Surge
card.gymh101.text: You can play this card only if you have at least 1 Basic Pokémon card in your hand. Put a Basic Pokémon card from your hand into play as your Active Pokémon. Put your old Active Pokémon onto your Bench. (You can't play this card if your Bench is full.)
card.gymh102.name: Misty
card.gymh102.text: Discard 2 of the other cards in your hand in order to play this card. If this turn's attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), and if the attacking Pokémon has Misty in its name, the attack does 20 more damage to the Defending Pokémon.
card.gymh103.name: No Removal Gym
card.gymh103.text: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. A player must discard 2 cards from his or her hand in order to play an Energy Removal or Super Energy Removal card.
card.gymh104.name: The Rocket's Training Gym
card.gymh104.text: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. Each player pays Colorless more to retreat his or her Active Pokémon.
card.gymh105.name: Blaine's Last Resort
card.gymh105.text: You can't play this card if you have any cards in your hand other than Blaine's Last Resort. Show your hand to your opponent, then draw 5 cards.
card.gymh106.name: Brock's Training Method
card.gymh106.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card with Brock in its name. Show that card to your opponent, then put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
card.gymh107.name: Celadon City Gym
card.gymh107.text: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. During each player's turn, that player may choose to discard an Energy card attached to 1 of his or her Pokémon with Erika in its name. If that player does so, that Pokémon is no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned.
card.gymh108.name: Cerulean City Gym
card.gymh108.text: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. Each player pays Colorless less to retreat his or her Pokémon if it has Misty in its name.
card.gymh109.name: Erika's Maids
card.gymh109.text: Trade 2 of the other cards in your hand for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and/or Evolution cards with Erika in their names from your deck. Show those cards to your opponent, then put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
card.gymh11.name: Rocket's Hitmonchan
attack.gymh11.1.name: Crosscounter
attack.gymh11.1.text: If an attack does damage to Rocket's Hitmonchan during your opponent's next turn (even if Rocket's Hitmonchan is Knocked Out), flip a coin. If heads, Rocket's Hitmonchan attacks your opponent's Active Pokémon for double that amount of damage. (If Rocket's Hitmonchan takes 20 damage, it does 40 damage to that Pokémon.)
attack.gymh11.2.name: Magnum Punch
card.gymh110.name: Erika's Perfume
card.gymh110.text: Look at your opponent's hand. If he or she has any Basic Pokémon cards there, you may put any number of them onto your opponent's Bench (as long as there's room).
card.gymh111.name: Good Manners
card.gymh111.text: In order to play this card, you can't have any Basic Pokémon cards in your hand. Show your hand to your opponent, then search your deck for a Basic Pokémon card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
card.gymh112.name: Lt. Surge's Treaty
card.gymh112.text: Your opponent chooses 1 of the following: everyone chooses 1 of his or her own Prizes and put it into his or her hand, or you draw a card.
card.gymh113.name: Minion of Team Rocket
card.gymh113.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and return it and all cards attached to it to his or her hand. If 1 or both of them are tails, your turn ends immediately (you can't attack this turn).
card.gymh114.name: Misty's Wrath
card.gymh114.text: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. Choose 2 of those cards and put them into your hand. Discard the rest.
card.gymh115.name: Pewter City Gym
card.gymh115.text: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. Don't apply Resistance to any attacks made by Pokémon with Brock in their names.
card.gymh116.name: Recall
card.gymh116.text: For your attack this turn, your Active Pokémon can use any attack from its Basic Pokémon card or any Evolution card attached to it. (You still have to pay for that attack's Energy cost.)
card.gymh117.name: Sabrina's ESP
card.gymh117.text: Attach Sabrina's ESP to 1 of your Pokémon with Sabrina in its name. At the end of your turn, discard Sabrina's ESP. If that Pokémon uses and attack that involves flipping coins, Sabrina's ESP lets you re-flip those coins once. If you do, re-flip all the coins.
card.gymh118.name: Secret Mission
card.gymh118.text: Look at your opponent's hand. Then, you may discard as many other cards as you want from your hand and draw that many cards.
card.gymh119.name: Tickling Machine
card.gymh119.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent sets aside all the cards in his or her hand face down. Nobody may look at those cards. At the end of your opponent's next turn, your opponent puts those cards back into his or her hand. If tails, your turn ends immediately (you can't attack this turn).
card.gymh12.name: Rocket's Moltres
attack.gymh12.1.name: Fire Wall
attack.gymh12.1.text: If an attack does damage to Rocket's Moltres during your opponent's next turn (even if Rocket's Moltres is Knocked Out), Rocket's Moltres attacks your opponent's Active Pokémon for 10 damage. (Apply Weakness and Resistance.)
card.gymh120.name: Vermilion City Gym
card.gymh120.text: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. Whenever a player attacks with a Pokémon with Lt. Surge in its name, he or she may flip a coin. If heads, and if that Pokémon's attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 10 more damage to the Defending Pokémon. If tails, the attacking Pokémon does 10 damage to itself in addition to whatever its attack usually does.
card.gymh121.name: Blaine's Gamble
card.gymh121.text: Discard any number of other cards from your hand, then flip a coin. If heads, draw twice that many cards.
card.gymh122.name: Energy Flow
card.gymh122.text: For each of your Pokémon, you may return any number of Energy cards attached to it to your hand.
card.gymh123.name: Misty's Duel
card.gymh123.text: You and your opponent play a game of Rock-Paper-Scissors. The winner shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck and draws a new hand of 5 cards. (If you don't know how to play Rock-Paper-Scissors, flip a coin to decide who's the winner.)
card.gymh124.name: Narrow Gym
card.gymh124.text: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. No player may have more than 4 Pokémon on his or her Bench. When this card is played, if a player has 5 Pokémon on his or her Bench, that player chooses 1 of them and returns it and all cards attached to it to his or her hand. (If both players have to return a Pokémon, your opponent returns a Pokémon first.)
card.gymh125.name: Sabrina's Gaze
card.gymh125.text: Each player shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck and draws a new hand of the same number of cards.
card.gymh126.name: Trash Exchange
card.gymh126.text: Count the number of cards in your discard pile and shuffle them into your deck. Then discard that many cards from the top of your deck.

attack.gymh83.2.name: Razor Wind
attack.gymh83.2.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.
card.gymh84.name: Lt. Surge's Voltorb
attack.gymh84.1.name: Spin Ball
attack.gymh84.1.text: Flip 1 coin. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.
attack.gymh84.2.name: Double Spin
attack.gymh84.2.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.
card.gymh85.name: Misty's Goldeen
attack.gymh85.1.name: Fury Attack
attack.gymh85.1.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.
attack.gymh85.2.name: Supersonic
attack.gymh85.2.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.
card.gymh86.name: Misty's Horsea
attack.gymh86.1.name: Tackle
attack.gymh86.2.name: Smokescreen
attack.gymh86.2.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.
card.gymh87.name: Misty's Poliwag
attack.gymh87.1.name: Hypnotic Stare
attack.gymh87.1.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.
attack.gymh87.2.name: Tail Rap
attack.gymh87.2.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attack.gymh88.1.name: Aurora Beam
card.gymh89.name: Misty's Shellder
attack.gymh89.1.name: Tackle
attack.gymh89.2.name: Clamp
attack.gymh89.2.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).
card.gymh9.name: Misty's Seadra
attack.gymh9.1.name: Tail Snap
attack.gymh9.2.name: Knockout Needle
attack.gymh9.2.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 60 more damage. If 1 or both of them are tails, this attack does 30 damage.
card.gymh90.name: Misty's Staryu
attack.gymh90.1.name: Swift
attack.gymh90.1.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Pokémon Powers, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.
card.gymh91.name: Sabrina's Abra
attack.gymh91.1.name: Energy Loop
attack.gymh91.1.text: Return a Psychic Energy card attached to Sabrina's Abra to your hand in order to use this attack.
card.gymh92.name: Sabrina's Drowzee
attack.gymh92.1.name: Suggestion
attack.gymh92.1.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.
attack.gymh92.2.name: Headbutt
card.gymh93.name: Sabrina's Gastly
attack.gymh93.1.name: Spook
attack.gymh93.1.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.
card.gymh94.name: Sabrina's Mr. Mime
attack.gymh94.1.name: Sleight of Hand
attack.gymh94.1.text: Choose up to 3 cards from your hand and put them on top of your deck. Then search your deck for that many basic Energy cards. Show those cards to your opponent, then put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
attack.gymh94.2.name: Slap
card.gymh95.name: Sabrina's Slowpoke
attack.gymh95.1.name: Lazy Attack
attack.gymh95.1.text: Sabrina's Slowpoke is now Asleep (after doing damage).
card.gymh96.name: Sabrina's Venonat
attack.gymh96.1.name: Poison Antennae
attack.gymh96.1.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.
attack.gymh96.2.name: Removal Beam
attack.gymh96.2.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of those Energy cards and discard it.
card.gymh97.name: Blaine's Quiz #1
card.gymh97.text: Put a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card from your hand face down in front of you and tell your opponent its name. Your opponent guesses the length of that Pokémon. Flip the card over. If your opponent guessed right, he or she draws 2 cards. If your opponent guessed wrong, you draw 2 cards. Either way, return the card to your hand.
card.gymh98.name: Brock
card.gymh98.text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.
card.gymh99.name: Charity
card.gymh99.text: Attach Charity to your Active Pokémon. Unless that Pokémon gets Knocked Out, return Charity to your hand at the end of your turn. If that Pokémon attacks and does damage to the Defending Pokémon, you may reduce that damage by any amount (rounded to the nearest 10).
set.gymc.name: Gym Challenge
card.gymc1.name: Blaine's Arcanine
attack.gymc1.1.name: Heat Tackle
attack.gymc1.1.text: Blaine's Arcanine does 10 damage to itself.
attack.gymc1.2.name: Firestorm
attack.gymc1.2.text: Discard 3 Fire Energy cards attached to Blaine's Arcanine in order to use this attack.
card.gymc10.name: Koga's Ditto
attack.gymc10.1.name: Giant Growth
attack.gymc10.1.text: Flip a coin. If heads, Koga's Ditto's maximum HP is now 80 and Koga's Ditto's Pound attack's base damage is 30 instead of 10. (Benching Koga's Ditto ends this effect.)
attack.gymc10.2.name: Pound
card.gymc100.name: Blaine
card.gymc100.text: During this turn, instead of attaching your free Energy card, you may instead attach 2 Fire Energy cards to 1 of your Pokémon with Blaine in its name. (Playing additional copies of this card this turn has no effect.)
card.gymc101.name: Brock's Protection
card.gymc101.text: Attach Brock's Protection to 1 of your Pokémon with Brock in its name. Energy cards attached to that Pokémon can't be removed by your opponent's attacks or Trainer cards. (This doesn't stop the rest of the attack or Trainer card from working normally.)
card.gymc102.name: Chaos Gym
card.gymc102.text: This card stays in play after being played. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. Whenever a player plays a Trainer card other than a Stadium card, he or she flips a coin. If heads, that player plays that card normally. If tails, the player can't play that card. If the card isn't put into play, the player's opponent may use that card instead, if he or she does everything required in order to play that card (like discarding cards). Either way, the card goes to its owner's discard pile.
card.gymc103.name: Erika's Kindness
card.gymc103.text: Remove 2 damage counters from each Pokémon (yours and your opponent's) with any damage counters on it. If a Pokémon has just 1 damage counter, remove it.
card.gymc104.name: Giovanni
card.gymc104.text: Choose 1 of your Pokémon in play with Giovanni in its name. For the rest of your turn, you may evolve that Pokémon even if you just played or evolved it this turn or if this is your first turn. This effect also applies to the Pokémon it evolves into.
card.gymc105.name: Giovanni's Last Resort
card.gymc105.text: Remove all damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon with Giovanni in its name. Then discard your hand.
card.gymc106.name: Koga
card.gymc106.text: If an attack from a Pokémon with Koga in its name does damage to a Defending Pokémon this turn, that Pokémon is then Poisoned.
card.gymc107.name: Lt. Surge's Secret Plan
card.gymc107.text: Put 1 card from your hand face down onto your Bench. (You can't play this card if your Bench is full.) Treat that card as a Basic Pokémon as long as it's face down. Flip the card if either player needs to know what it is in order to use an attack, a Pokémon Power, or a Trainer card. Flip the card if it ever uses an attack or Pokémon Power, evolves, retreats, is damaged by an attack, or is otherwise affected by an attack. At any time during your turn, you may flip the card over. When you flip that card over, if it isn't a Basic Pokémon, discard it and all cards attached to it.
card.gymc108.name: Misty's Wish
card.gymc108.text: Look at 1 of your Prize cards. Then, ask your opponent if you may switch that card with 1 of the cards in your hand. If your opponent accepts and if you have any other cards in your hand, switch those cards. If your opponent declines, return the Prize card face down and draw a card.
card.gymc109.name: Resistance Gym
card.gymc109.text: This card stays in play after being played. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. Each Pokémon's Resistance is reduced by 20. (If a Pokémon's Resistance is -30, it becomes -10.)
card.gymc11.name: Lt. Surge's Raichu
attack.gymc11.1.name: Kerzap
attack.gymc11.1.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 30 more damage to the Defending Pokémon and discard all Lightning Energy cards attached to Lt. Surge's Raichu. If tails, this attack does 20 damage.
attack.gymc11.2.name: Thundertackle
attack.gymc11.2.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, Lt. Surge's Raichu does 20 damage to itself.
card.gymc110.name: Sabrina
card.gymc110.text: Take all Energy cards attached to 1 of your Pokémon with Sabrina in its name and attach them to another 1 of your Pokémon with Sabrina in its name.
card.gymc111.name: Blaine's Quiz #2
card.gymc111.text: Put a card from your hand face down in front of you. Your opponent guesses whether it is an Energy card, a Trainer card, or a Pokémon (Basic or Evolution) card. Flip the card over. If your opponent guessed right, he or she draws 2 cards. If your opponent guessed wrong, you draw 2 cards. Either way, return the card to your hand.
card.gymc112.name: Blaine's Quiz #3
card.gymc112.text: Put a Basic or Evolution card from your hand face down in front of you and tell your opponent the name of an attack of that card. Your opponent guesses the name of that card. Flip the card over. If your opponent guessed right, he or she draws 3 cards. If your opponent guessed wrong, you draw 3 cards. Either way, return the card to your hand.
card.gymc113.name: Cinnabar City Gym
card.gymc113.text: This card stays in play after being played. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. Ignore Weakness when a Water Pokémon does damage to a Pokémon with Blaine in its name.
card.gymc114.name: Fuchsia City Gym
card.gymc114.text: This card stays in play after being played. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. Once during each player's turn (before attacking), that player may flip a coin. If heads, that player may shuffle 1 of his or her Pokémon in play with Koga in its name and any cards attached to it into his or her deck.
card.gymc115.name: Koga's Ninja Trick
card.gymc115.text: Attach Koga's Ninja Trick to your Active Pokémon with Koga in its name. If this Pokémon goes to your Bench, discard this card. When your opponent attacks, you may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon (before damage or other effects of attacks).
card.gymc116.name: Master Ball
card.gymc116.text: Look at 7 cards from the top of your deck. You may choose a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card from those cards, show it to your opponent, then put it into your hand. Shuffle the rest into your deck.
card.gymc117.name: Max Revive
card.gymc117.text: Discard 2 Energy cards from your hand in order to put 1 Basic Pokémon from your discard pile onto your Bench. (You can't play Max Revive if your Bench is full.)
card.gymc118.name: Misty's Tears
card.gymc118.text: Discard 1 of the other cards in your hand in order to search your deck for up to 2 Water Energy cards. Show those cards to your opponent, then put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
card.gymc119.name: Rocket's Minefield Gym
card.gymc119.text: This card stays in play after being played. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. Whenever a player puts a Basic Pokémon onto his or her Bench from his or her hand, he or she flips a coin. If tails, put damage counters on that Pokémon.
card.gymc12.name: Misty's Golduck
attack.gymc12.1.name: Electro Beam
attack.gymc12.1.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard all Energy cards attached to Misty's Golduck.
attack.gymc12.2.name: Super Removal
attack.gymc12.2.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 Energy card attached to each of your opponent's Pokémon that has any Energy cards and discard those Energy cards.
card.gymc120.name: Rocket's Secret Experiment
card.gymc120.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for any card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. If tails, you can't play Trainer cards until the end of your next turn.
card.gymc121.name: Sabrina's Psychic Control
card.gymc121.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a Trainer card in your opponent's discard pile that isn't put in play (like PlusPower or Mysterious Fossil). You may use that card as if it were in your hand, if you do everything required in order to play that card (like discarding cards). The card stays in your opponent's discard pile.
card.gymc122.name: Saffron City Gym
card.gymc122.text: This card stays in play after being played. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. As often as each player like during his or her turn (before attacking), that player may return 1 basic Energy card attached to 1 of his or her Pokémon with Sabrina in its name to his or her hand.
card.gymc123.name: Viridian City Gym
card.gymc123.text: This card stays in play after being played. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. Whenever a Pokémon with Giovanni in its name evolves, its owner removes 2 damage counters from that Pokémon (or 1 if it only has 1).
card.gymc124.name: Fervor
card.gymc124.text: Show the top 3 cards of your deck to all players. Put any Fire Energy cards there into your hand and discard the rest.
card.gymc125.name: Transparent Walls
card.gymc125.text: Until the end of your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from attacks done to your Benched Pokémon. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)
card.gymc126.name: Warp Point
card.gymc126.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with his or her Active Pokémon, then, if you have any Benched Pokémon, you switch 1 of them with your Active Pokémon.
card.gymc127.name: Fighting Energy
card.gymc128.name: Fire Energy
card.gymc129.name: Grass Energy

attack.gymc13.1.name: Tidal Wave
card.gymc130.name: Lightning Energy
card.gymc131.name: Psychic Energy
card.gymc132.name: Water Energy
card.gymc14.name: Rocket's Mewtwo
attack.gymc14.1.name: Juxtapose
attack.gymc14.1.text: Flip a coin. If heads, switch the number of damage counters on Rocket's Mewtwo with the number of damage counters on the Defending Pokémon (even if it would Knock Out either Pokémon). (It's okay if 1 of the Pokémon has no damage counters on it.)
attack.gymc14.2.name: Hypnoblast
attack.gymc14.2.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.
attack.gymc14.3.name: Psyburn
card.gymc15.name: Rocket's Zapdos
attack.gymc15.1.name: Plasma
attack.gymc15.1.text: If there are any Lightning Energy cards in your discard pile, attach 1 of them to Rocket's Zapdos.
attack.gymc15.2.name: Electroburn
attack.gymc15.2.text: Rocket's Zapdos does damage to itself equal to 10 times the number of Lightning Energy cards attached to it.
card.gymc16.name: Sabrina's Alakazam
attack.gymc16.1.name: Mega Burn
attack.gymc16.1.text: You can't use this attack during your next turn.
card.gymc17.name: Blaine
card.gymc17.text: During this turn, instead of attaching your free Energy card, you may instead attach 2 Fire Energy cards to 1 of your Pokémon with Blaine in its name. (Playing additional copies of this card this turn has no effect.)
card.gymc18.name: Giovanni
card.gymc18.text: Choose 1 of your Pokémon in play with Giovanni in its name. For the rest of your turn, you may evolve that Pokémon even if you just played or evolved it this turn or if this is your first turn. This effect also applies to the Pokémon it evolves into.
card.gymc19.name: Koga
card.gymc19.text: If an attack from a Pokémon with Koga in its name does damage to a Defending Pokémon this turn, that Pokémon is then Poisoned.
card.gymc2.name: Blaine's Charizard
attack.gymc2.1.name: Roaring Flames
attack.gymc2.1.text: Discard all Fire Energy cards attached to Blaine's Charizard. If all Energy cards attached to Blaine's Charizard provide 2 Fire Energy, discard all of them. This attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each Fire Energy discarded in this way.
attack.gymc2.2.name: Flame Jet
attack.gymc2.2.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)
card.gymc20.name: Sabrina
card.gymc20.text: Take all Energy cards attached to 1 of your Pokémon with Sabrina in its name and attach them to another 1 of your Pokémon with Sabrina in its name.
card.gymc21.name: Blaine's Ninetales
attack.gymc21.1.name: Burn Up
attack.gymc21.1.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard all Fire Energy cards attached to Blaine's Ninetales.
card.gymc22.name: Brock's Dugtrio
attack.gymc22.1.name: Lie Low
attack.gymc22.1.text: All damage done to Brock's Dugtrio during your opponent's next turn is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
attack.gymc22.2.name: Earthdrill
attack.gymc22.2.text: This attack can't be used unless Brock's Dugtrio used its Lie Low attack last turn.
card.gymc23.name: Giovanni's Nidoqueen
attack.gymc23.1.name: Mega Kick
attack.gymc23.2.name: Love Lariat
attack.gymc23.2.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 50 more damage if you have at least 1 Giovanni's Nidoking on your Bench. If tails, this attack does nothing.
card.gymc24.name: Giovanni's Pinsir
attack.gymc24.1.name: Snapping Pincers
attack.gymc24.1.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.
attack.gymc24.2.name: Overhead Toss
attack.gymc24.2.text: If you have any Benched Pokémon, flip a coin. If tails, choose 1 of your Benched Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
card.gymc25.name: Koga's Arbok
attack.gymc25.1.name: Poison Buildup
attack.gymc25.2.name: Poison Power
attack.gymc25.2.text: If Koga's Arbok is Poisoned, this attack's base damage is 40 instead of 20 and the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.
card.gymc26.name: Koga's Muk
attack.gymc26.1.name: Sludge Whirlpool
card.gymc27.name: Koga's Pidgeotto
attack.gymc27.1.name: Quick Turn
attack.gymc27.1.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.
attack.gymc27.2.name: Aerial Maneuvers
attack.gymc27.2.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage, and, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Koga's Pidgeotto. If tails, this attack does 10 damage.
card.gymc28.name: Lt. Surge's Jolteon
attack.gymc28.1.name: High Voltage
attack.gymc28.1.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play Trainer cards during his or her next turn.
attack.gymc28.2.name: Thunder Flare
attack.gymc28.2.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Lt. Surge's Jolteon, then flip a coin. If tails, Lt. Surge's Jolteon does 30 damage to itself.
card.gymc29.name: Sabrina's Gengar
attack.gymc29.1.name: Dark Wave
attack.gymc29.1.text: All Pokémon Powers stop working until the end of your opponent's next turn.
attack.gymc29.2.name: Shadow Bind
attack.gymc29.2.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.
card.gymc3.name: Brock's Ninetales
attack.gymc3.1.name: Will-o'-the-wisp
card.gymc30.name: Sabrina's Golduck
attack.gymc30.1.name: Damage Shift
attack.gymc30.1.text: Move 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon that has any on it to the Defending Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.)
attack.gymc30.2.name: Water Spray
attack.gymc30.2.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.
card.gymc31.name: Blaine's Charmeleon
attack.gymc31.1.name: Fire Claws
attack.gymc31.2.name: Bonfire
attack.gymc31.2.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Blaine's Charmeleon. If you can't discard Energy cards, this attack does nothing. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads to each of your opponent's Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)
card.gymc32.name: Blaine's Dodrio
attack.gymc32.1.name: Mega Peck
attack.gymc32.1.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.
card.gymc33.name: Blaine's Rapidash
attack.gymc33.1.name: Fire Mane
attack.gymc33.2.name: Stamp
attack.gymc33.2.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage (to the Defending Pokémon) and 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) If tails, this attack does 30 damage (to the Defending Pokémon).
card.gymc34.name: Brock's Graveler
attack.gymc34.1.name: Tackle
attack.gymc34.2.name: Detonate
attack.gymc34.2.text: Does 10 damage to each Pokémon on each player's bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Brock's Graveler does 50 damage to itself. If there is a Stadium card in play, discard it.
card.gymc35.name: Brock's Primeape
attack.gymc35.1.name: Mega Thrash
attack.gymc35.1.text: Brock's Primeape does 20 damage to itself. If there is a Stadium card in play, discard it.
card.gymc36.name: Brock's Sandslash
attack.gymc36.1.name: Swift
attack.gymc36.1.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Pokémon Powers, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.
attack.gymc36.2.name: Needle Ball
attack.gymc36.2.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.
card.gymc37.name: Brock's Vulpix
attack.gymc37.1.name: Hypnotic Gaze
attack.gymc37.1.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.
attack.gymc37.2.name: Fire Ring
attack.gymc37.2.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
card.gymc38.name: Erika's Bellsprout
attack.gymc38.1.name: Stretch Vine
attack.gymc38.1.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon, and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
card.gymc39.name: Erika's Bulbasaur
attack.gymc39.1.name: Sleep Seed
attack.gymc39.1.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.
attack.gymc39.2.name: Errand-Running
attack.gymc39.2.text: Flip a coin. If heads, you may search your deck for a Trainer card. Show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
card.gymc4.name: Erika's Venusaur
attack.gymc4.1.name: Growth
attack.gymc4.1.text: Flip a coin. If heads, you may attach up to 2 Grass Energy cards from your hand to Erika's Venusaur.
attack.gymc4.2.name: Wide Solarbeam
attack.gymc4.2.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 2 of them (or 1 if he or she only has 1). This attack does 20 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
card.gymc40.name: Erika's Clefairy
attack.gymc40.1.name: Lunar Power
attack.gymc40.1.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card that evolves from 1 of your Benched Pokémon and put that card on that Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.
attack.gymc40.2.name: Moon Kick
card.gymc41.name: Erika's Ivysaur
attack.gymc41.1.name: Double Razor Leaf
attack.gymc41.1.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.
card.gymc42.name: Giovanni's Machoke
attack.gymc42.1.name: Risky Attack
attack.gymc42.1.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does no damage to the Defending Pokémon and Giovanni's Machoke does 100 damage to itself.
attack.gymc42.2.name: Headlock
attack.gymc42.2.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, this attack does 20 damage.
card.gymc43.name: Giovanni's Meowth
attack.gymc43.1.name: False Charity
attack.gymc43.1.text: Flip a coin. If heads, look at the top card of your opponent's deck. If it's a Trainer card, put it in your opponent's discard pile; otherwise, put it into his or her hand.
attack.gymc43.2.name: Double Scratch
attack.gymc43.2.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.
card.gymc44.name: Giovanni's Nidorina
attack.gymc44.1.name: Poison Sting Tackle
attack.gymc44.1.text: Giovanni's Nidorina does 20 damage to itself. Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.
attack.gymc44.2.name: Body Slam
attack.gymc44.2.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
card.gymc45.name: Giovanni's Nidorino
attack.gymc45.1.name: Rend
attack.gymc45.1.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage. If not, this attack does 20 damage.
card.gymc46.name: Koga's Golbat
attack.gymc46.1.name: Bite
attack.gymc46.2.name: Sonic Scream
attack.gymc46.2.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.
